As we close out December 2025, the macro environment is weighing heavily on $BTC  price action. Furthermore, new EU digital asset tax laws and the GENIUS Act implementation have created a temporary liquidity vacuum. The DXY is hovering near 98, creating a natural headwind for risk assets.  Short-term: Volatility will likely remain suppressed due to the holiday lull, with $BTC   potentially drifting toward the $85,000 support floor. Mid-term: I am looking toward the January FOMC meeting as the next major catalyst. While the 30% drop from the $126k peak looks drastic, Bitcoin's institutional floor is now much higher than in previous cycles. Looking at the 24h and 4h charts, $BTC   is currently struggling to maintain its footing around the $87,281 mark. The daily timeframe reveals a sobering picture: we are trading significantly below both the 50-day MA ($91,442) and the 200-day MA ($107,497). This alignment suggests that the parabolic momentum from earlier this year has shifted into a structural downtrend. On the 4h chart, the price is being rejected consistently by local EMA resistances, showing a lack of immediate buying pressure.  Short-term: I expect a test of the psychological support at $84,000. If liquidity remains thin during this holiday week, a brief wick down to $81,000 is highly probable to flush out late-year leverage. Mid-term: The trend remains bearish until we can reclaim and hold the $95,000 level with significant volume. For now, the "path of least resistance" is unfortunately downward. Patience is your best friend here; don't rush into a falling knife.  #BTC  #TechnicalAnalysis  üìä

Uniswap token holders approved the UNification proposal, enabling the protocol‚Äôs fee switch. After a two-day timelock, the protocol will initiate an immediate burn of 100m $UNI.

Options expiry around 82K and 95K is more about where liquidity gets cleared than forcing direction. 

Large expiries usually compress volatility first as dealers hedge, then release pressure once positions roll off.

If  $BTC price holds above key spot support after expiry, it suggests selling pressure has already been absorbed. 

A clean break below support would signal unresolved downside. 

Until then, #BTC market is likely deciding who gets trapped, not choosing a trend yet.

3. Native Bitcoin Layer 2s (L2s)
Because Bitcoin‚Äôs main layer is slow, price discovery often happens on centralized exchanges (Binance, Coinbase) where AI dominates. Developers are moving discovery back to decentralized "rails":
 * Stacks & Lightning Network: By building faster layers on top of Bitcoin, developers are allowing for decentralized exchanges (DEXs) that can compete with the speed of institutional bots.

REAL TALK: 
When you 'learn one market', It's almost as if you are not listening to the market, but you are telling it where to move.

and it's the exact trap that wrecks most traders in the long run.

When you "learn" a market to the point where you think you've cracked its code (patterns, cycles, narratives), you stop listening to what price is actually saying in the present. Instead, you start forcing your story onto it: "This is the dip before the moon," "Cycle isn't over," "Accumulation phase," etc.

The market doesn't care about your elegant thesis. It moves on liquidity, order flow, whale positioning, and macro shocks, not your mental model.

The moment you tell the market where it should go instead of reacting to where it is going, you've flipped from trader to gambler with a bias. Price becomes the ultimate humility teacher: it punishes conviction faster than doubt.

Real edge comes from staying agnostic, letting price action dictate, cutting losers quick, and riding winners without a script. The market whispers the truth every day, most people are too busy shouting their predictions to hear it.

Always remember to stay humble, or the market will humble you. üî•

3 Reasons Why Bitcoin Halving Occurs  Bitcoin halving is a pre-programmed event in the Bitcoin network, where the amount of $BTC  miners receive for validating transactions and adding new blocks to the blockchain is cut in half.  Here are 3 reasons why the Bitcoin halving is important:  1/ Inflation Prevention: By slowing down how many new bitcoins enter circulation, Bitcoin‚Äôs inflation is prevented.  2/ Ensuring Scarcity: Since only 21 million bitcoins will ever exist, halving makes sure they are released gradually.  3/ Supporting Value: With fewer new bitcoins created, the limited supply helps maintain or increase Bitcoin‚Äôs price if demand stays the same or grows.  #Bitcoin  #BTC

ShillGuard | Weekend Perspective üìä

Weekend crypto markets may feel calm, but that can be misleading. Trading volume on weekends has declined - for $BTC, only about 13% of transactions happen on Saturdays and Sundays. Lower participation often means reduced liquidity and wider spreads, which can exaggerate price moves even with smaller orders.

Why it matters

üìâ Low liquidity - thinner markets can show bigger swings with smaller flows.
üè¶ Institutional activity - most traditional institutions and ETFs trade on weekdays, concentrating volume then and making weekend moves behave differently.
üîç Trend context - weekend behavior provides insights for early-week trends without predicting price direction.

Understanding weekend liquidity and participation patterns helps put price moves into perspective.
